summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview transcript from March 16, 2022, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview focuses on camera system failures at MCC New York on August 8-10, 2019, a phone call Epstein allegedly made on August 9, and emergency response procedures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the center of the investigation; discussed regarding his death, phone call made on August 9, 2019, and his cell assignment.

persons.name: Lieutenant T. [Redacted]
persons.role: SIS Lieutenant, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: The witness being interviewed; discusses discovering camera system failures on August 8, 2019, notifying superiors, and her memo about the incident.

persons.name: Hughwon [Redacted]
persons.context: BOP communications tech who was notified about and worked on fixing the camera system on August 8-10, 2019.

persons.name: Captain J. [Redacted]
persons.context: Captain at MCC New York whom the witness claims she notified about the camera system failure on August 8, 2019.

persons.name: AW [Redacted]
persons.context: Associate Warden from MCC New York who was present when the witness first noticed the camera playback issue on August 8, 2019.

persons.name: Special Agent [Redacted]
persons.context: Primary OIG investigator conducting the interview.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent-in-Charge [Redacted]
persons.context: Second OIG investigator present during the interview.

persons.name: Unit Manager Bullock
persons.context: Mentioned as the staff member who allegedly gave Jeffrey Epstein a phone call on the night of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Correctional Officer Tova Noel
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the officers who discovered Epstein and would have activated an emergency alarm.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the officers who discovered Epstein along with Tova Noel.

persons.name: OIG Agent [Redacted]
persons.context: Mentioned by the witness as an investigator she was working with on an unrelated inmate incident prior to August 8, 2019.

persons.name: Inmate Reyes
persons.context: Inmate assigned to the same tier (L-tier) as Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit.

connections.description: Witness notified the communications tech about camera system failures and later discussed his repair work.
Witness reported the camera system failure to the Captain and provided him a memorandum.
Were together reviewing cameras when the playback issue was first discovered on August 8, 2019.
Allegedly provided Epstein with a phone call on the night of August 9, 2019.
Both were correctional officers on duty who discovered Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Camera System Failure Discovered
events.description: Lieutenant T. [Redacted] discovers the NiceVision camera system at MCC New York is not recording and many camera feeds are blacked out. She notifies communications tech Hughwon [Redacted] and Captain J. [Redacted].

events.title: Epstein's Alleged Phone Call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is allegedly given a phone call by Unit Manager Bullock on a non-recorded line. The call is reported to be to his mother (who was deceased). A call log from 6:58 PM to 7:19 PM on August 9 is discussed.

events.title: Camera System Repair Follow-up
events.description: Lieutenant T. [Redacted] follows up with Hughwon [Redacted] about the camera repairs. He states he 'fixed it yesterday' (August 9) and was there to 'finish up'.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found deceased in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York. Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas discover him.

events.title: OIG Interview Conducted
events.description: DOJ Office of the Inspector General interviews BOP Lieutenant T. [Redacted] as part of the investigation into events surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York (interview location)
MCC New York, 150 Park Road, New York (primary location of discussed events)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
5-South housing unit (cadre unit) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The camera system at MCC New York was not recording and had multiple blacked-out feeds on August 8, 2019, just days before Epstein's death.
A BOP lieutenant wrote a memorandum on August 10, 2019, documenting the camera system failure that began on August 8.
Jeffrey Epstein allegedly made a phone call on August 9, 2019, facilitated by Unit Manager Bullock, which the witness believed was against policy as it was not on a recorded line.
The witness states that allowing an unmonitored personal call was against policy and a security risk, as staff couldn't review the call for threats or other issues.
Epstein was housed in cell 220-L on L-tier in the Special Housing Unit, with inmate Reyes in cell 220-U, according to a SHU locator form dated August 9-10, 2019.
